title: math expr with pos value - determine preconditions

content.description:
The following code segment appears in a method. In the code segment,  x  and  y  are properly declared and initialized  int  variables.
 System.out.println(x * x * y);
content.question: Which of the following preconditions for the method is most appropriate to ensure that the value printed by the code segment is always greater than zero?

choices.label:
/**
 * Preconditions: x is greater than zero.
 * y is not equal to zero.
 */

/**
 * Preconditions: x is not equal to zero.
 * y is greater than zero.
 */

/**
 * Preconditions: x is even and is not equal to zero.
 * y is not equal to zero.
 */

/**
 * Preconditions: x is not equal to zero.
 * y is even and is not equal to zero.
 */

content.answer:
/**
 * Preconditions: x is not equal to zero.
 * y is greater than zero.
 */

skill.text: 4.B: Describe the initial conditions that must be met for a code segment to work as intended or described.
